file_content.text: Commander--just picked up some critical intel on a small group of rogue Republic scientists led by Doctor Alirra Semhess. They're working on a new adrenal called RS-33.
Nice work, Commander. Wasn't looking forward to fighting a galactic war against Doctor Semhess and her army of scientific abominations.
And don't worry about anyone else using RS-33, or continuing her experiments. Your assault on the lab destroyed all her research.
It's still in the experimental stages, but rumors suggest it enhances strength and speed at the cost of mental faculties. Makes the users hyper-violent.
We tracked Doctor Semhess to a secret lab inside a Republic space station. We need to stop them before they create an army of unstoppable, mindless super soldiers.
And if you're wondering about using RS-33 on our own troops, forget it. Your assault on the lab destroyed her research.
For the record, I think that's a good thing. If you ask me, the galaxy already has more than enough unstoppable, hyper-violent monsters.
After months of stalled development on RS-33, Doctor Rahser Poth has made a major breakthrough by synthesizing the RAK-5 serum.
RAK-5 isolates the rakghoul plague's genetic mutation in a stable form. Exposure to RAK-5 causes major, but temporary, physical transformations in all subjects.
Initial testing indicates we could replicate similar bio-chemical markers in RS-33 while suppressing the undesirable transformative properties.
Once RS-33 is perfected, the Republic will command an army of unstoppable super-soldiers. We will reclaim our rightful place as the dominant power in the galaxy.
Given the unorthodox--and unsavory--origins of the serum, there are considerable risks. However, the benefits--increased strength, agility, and aggression--more than compensate.
We have reached the final testing stages on the RS-33 adrenal. Volatility has been minimized, and soon we will be able to produce it in mass quantities.
